gui

Class SetupPhase

  • java.lang.Object
    • gui.SetupPhase

  • public class SetupPhase
extends java.lang.Object
    The setup phase where players setup their ships in their board. Players are given a number of ships for each specific ship length. Players have to setup all the given ships.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      SetupPhase(javafx.scene.Scene scn, java.lang.String playerSettingUp, int numOfShips, boolean displayonly)
      The constructor of the SetupPhase.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SetupPhase

        public SetupPhase(javafx.scene.Scene scn,
                  java.lang.String playerSettingUp,
                  int numOfShips,
                  boolean displayonly)
        The constructor of the SetupPhase. It creates the display layout of the setup phase depending on which player is currently setting up. Using the three regions from BorderPane (center, bottom, right) it displays the current player's own board at the center region where they will be setting up. The right region contains a pane with buttons representing a ship length. Players will be choosing ships to place from the right pane and clicking at their own board to place it.
        Parameters:
        scn - - The scene of the game. changes the root as the setupPhase display changes.
        playerSettingUp - - a string indicating which player is setting up
        numOfShips - - an integer indicating the number of ships the player has to place in his/her board
        displayonly - - a boolean indicating if this layout will only be used for display. (event handlers are disabled)

    • Method Detail

      • centerPane

        public javafx.scene.layout.TilePane centerPane()
        The child node that will be placed in the center region of the main layout. The child node is a TilePane layout that contains a GridPane layout (created in BoardGUI) which is the display of the player's own board.
        Returns:
        a TilePane layout that displays the current player's own board

      • rightPanel

        public javafx.scene.layout.GridPane rightPanel()
        The child node that will be placed in the right region of the main layout. It consists of a GridPane layout with 4 rows and one column. Each row represents a section for a specific length of a ship. When displayOnly is true, buttons are hidden and this region only contains nothing but a background color. Button actions are directed into the SetupShipHandler.
        Returns:
        a GridPane layout that displays the ship lengths and the number of ships of a specific length the player can place. (when displayOnly is false)

      • buttonForShipLen

        public javafx.scene.layout.VBox buttonForShipLen(java.lang.String wordLen,
                                                 int shipLenCount,
                                                 int len)
        Creates the VBox layout for each ship length. The top section indicates the ship count of that specific length. At the bottom is the button.The button will be disabled if the ship count of the specific ship length is 0. The ship count will be used up when the player successfully sets up that specific ship length into his/her board. The ship count is created in settings which is taken from the array generatedShipsArray in Board class.
        Parameters:
        wordLen - - length of ship in string format
        shipLenCount - - amount of ships allowed at given length
        len - - length of ship
        Returns:
        section - a VBox layout of a section of a ship length

      • botPanel

        public javafx.scene.layout.GridPane botPanel()
        The bottom panel consists of messages for the user.
        Returns:
        a GridPane layout
